title: Growth Stocks Are Out of Favor. Momentum ETFs Can Ease the Pain.
text:
Momentum stocks have been in focus again over the past month as the market’s best-performing group tumbled amid a sharp rotation from high-growth names to cheaper-priced value stocks. A sudden shift in market sentiment is never good news for momentum investors, but they might feel less pain with some of the momentum ETFs.

Since the beginning of September, the Dow Jones U.S. High Momentum index, comprising 200 companies ranked as having the highest 12-month total return, has fallen 1.7%, while the S&P 500 has risen 1.7%....
description: A sudden shift in market sentiment is never good news for momentum investors, but they might feel less pain with some of the momentum ETFs.
